com.microsoft.azure.datalake.store

Class ADLFileInputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.InputStream
      • com.microsoft.azure.datalake.store.ADLFileInputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class ADLFileInputStream
extends InputStream
    ADLFileInputStream can be used to read data from an open file on ADL. It is a buffering stream, that reads data from the server in bulk, and then satisfies user reads from the buffer. Default buffer size is 4MB.

    Thread-safety: Note that methods in this class are NOT thread-safe.

      • readFromService

        protected long readFromService()
                        throws IOException
        Read from service attempts to read blocksize bytes from service. Returns how many bytes are actually read, could be less than blocksize.
        Returns:
        number of bytes actually read
        Throws:
        ADLException - if error
        IOException

      • slurpFullFile

        protected long slurpFullFile()
                      throws IOException
        Reads the whole file into buffer. Useful when reading small files.
        Returns:
        number of bytes actually read
        Throws:
        IOException - throws IOException if there is an error

      • read

        public int read(long position,
                byte[] b,
                int offset,
                int length)
         throws IOException
        Read upto the specified number of bytes, from a given position within a file, and return the number of bytes read. This does not change the current offset of a file.
        Parameters:
        position - position in file to read from
        b - byte[] buffer to read into
        offset - offset into the byte buffer at which to read the data into
        length - number of bytes to read
        Returns:
        the number of bytes actually read, which could be less than the bytes requested. If the position is at or after end of file, then -1 is returned.
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown if there is an error in reading

      • seek

        public void seek(long n)
          throws IOException,
                 EOFException
        Seek to given position in stream.
        Parameters:
        n - position to seek to
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is an error
        EOFException - if attempting to seek past end of file

        public void setReadAheadQueueDepth(int queueDepth)

        Parameters:

      • length

        public long length()
            throws IOException
        Returns the length of the file that this stream refers to. Note that the length returned is the length as of the time the Stream was opened. Specifically, if there have been subsequent appends to the file, they wont be reflected in the returned length.
        Returns:
        length of the file.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the stream is closed

      • unbuffer

        public void unbuffer()
              throws IOException
        invalidates the buffer. The next read will fetch data from server.
        Throws:
        IOException - throws IOException if there is an error
